summary: Biocatalysis uses enzymes to produce valuable products with fewer steps and reduced waste, leveraging advanced tools for enzyme engineering.
key_claims: The number of available protein sequences has increased by a staggering 20-fold in the past 5 years.
Directed evolution is enabling researchers to tailor enzymes for complex molecule synthesis and biodegradation.
Machine learning-driven protein-structure prediction, coupled with automation, is advancing enzyme engineering.
